Body:
I'm trying to write code that takes in a natural language sentence and determines what that sentence is about. Not from a list of possible subjects, but just from the input text, the NL sentence.

Most of these sentences will be NL questions.

What is the best way to determine the subject of a sentence / question; or in other words, what the sentence is about?

What I am currently doing is finding the nouns in the sentence, but the subject isn't always a noun.

I would greatly appreciate it if someone could help me write the psuedo-code of an algorithm that can do this properly.
Title: Algorithm for determining the subject of a NL sentence / question

LastEditedUser.AboutMe: I'm a PhD student in Linguistics at University College London. My primary area of interest is generative linguistics, and specifically syntactic and semantic theory. More narrowly still, i'm interested in ellipsis, comparatives, and binding theory. Follow me on twitter!
